page.title: 01Hurworth-on-Tees - Review
page.content: It is a flat agricultural area (rough grazing and mixed arable) with Hurworth village on the banks of the River Tees to the south and a small area of housing on the outskirts of Darlington to the north. It is mainly Hurworth C.P. 1981 population 3342.River Skerne runs from N to S and into River Tees.Alongside it is the main London-Edinburgh railway line.The new Darlington by-pass crosses from E to W.Hurworth, which began as a pre-Saxon settlement,is a picturesque village with houses on each side of a long village green.Recent housing developments have greatly enhanced the village.In the section are:-1.Sewage works.2.Municipal Golf Course.3.Disused clay and brick works.4.Hell's Kettles-two magnesian depression ponds,about 20'deep.Some rare plants grow beside them.
